First, the code structure:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main() {
    // Read input for first program
    long Q, H, S, D, N;
    scanf("%ld %ld %ld %ld %ld", &Q, &H, &S, &D, &N);

    // Compute first's output
    long onePrice = fmin(fmin(Q*4, H*2), S);
    long total;
    if (onePrice <= D / 2) {
        total = N * onePrice;
    } else {
        total = (N / 2)*D + (N % 2)*onePrice;
    }

    // Convert total to string
    char first_output[256];
    sprintf(first_output, "%ld", total);

    // Process through second program's logic
    int len = strlen(first_output);
    int co_x[len+1], co_y[len+1];
    int x = 0, y = 0;
    co_x[0] = x;
    co_y[0] = y;
    int i, j;
    for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
        char c = first_output[i];
        switch(c) {
            case 'L': x--; break;
            case 'R': x++; break;
            case 'U': y++; break;
            case 'D': y--; break;
            default: break; // do nothing for other characters
        }
        co_x[i+1] = x;
        co_y[i+1] = y;
    }

    int flag = 1;
    for (i = 0; i < (len - 2); i++) { // since k = len+1, so k-3 = len-2
        for (j = i + 3; j < (len +1); j++) {
            int dx = co_x[i] - co_x[j];
            if (dx <0) dx = -dx;
            int dy = co_y[i] - co_y[j];
            if (dy <0) dy = -dy;
            if ( (dx <=1 && dy ==0) || (dy <=1 && dx ==0) ) {
                flag = 0;
                goto check_done;
            }
        }
    }
    check_done:

    char second_output[4]; // "BUG" or "OK" are 3 and 3 characters (plus null)
    if (flag) {
        strcpy(second_output, "OK");
    } else {
        strcpy(second_output, "BUG");
    }

    // Process through third program's logic (replace commas with spaces)
    // Since second_output has no commas, it remains the same
    char third_output[4];
    strcpy(third_output, second_output);
    // Replace commas with spaces (though none here)
    for (i = 0; third_output[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        if (third_output[i] == ',') {
            third_output[i] = ' ';
        }
    }

    // Output the final result
    printf("%s\n", third_output);

    return 0;
}

So the final code would be:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {
    long Q, H, S, D, N;
    scanf("%ld %ld %ld %ld %ld", &Q, &H, &S, &D, &N);

    long onePrice = fmin(fmin(Q * 4, H * 2), S);
    long total;
    if (onePrice <= D / 2) {
        total = N * onePrice;
    } else {
        total = (N / 2) * D + (N % 2) * onePrice;
    }

    char first_output[256];
    sprintf(first_output, "%ld", total);

    int len = strlen(first_output);
    int co_x[101], co_y[101];
    int x = 0, y = 0;
    co_x[0] = x;
    co_y[0] = y;
    int i, j;
    for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
        char c = first_output[i];
        switch (c) {
            case 'L': x--; break;
            case 'R': x++; break;
            case 'U': y++; break;
            case 'D': y--; break;
            default: break;
        }
        co_x[i + 1] = x;
        co_y[i + 1] = y;
    }

    int flag = 1;
    for (i = 0; i < (len - 2); i++) {
        for (j = i + 3; j < (len + 1); j++) {
            int dx = co_x[i] - co_x[j];
            if (dx < 0) dx = -dx;
            int dy = co_y[i] - co_y[j];
            if (dy < 0) dy = -dy;
            if ((dx <= 1 && dy == 0) || (dy <= 1 && dx == 0)) {
                flag = 0;
                goto check_done;
            }
        }
    }
    check_done:

    char second_output[4];
    if (flag) {
        strcpy(second_output, "OK");
    } else {
        strcpy(second_output, "BUG");
    }

    char third_output[4];
    strcpy(third_output, second_output);
    for (i = 0; third_output[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        if (third_output[i] == ',') {
            third_output[i] = ' ';
        }
    }

    printf("%s\n", third_output);

    return 0;
}

This should handle all cases correctly.
